00015 #define REVERSE_BYTE_ORDER_16( y ) ( ( ( y & 0x00FF ) << 8 ) | ( ( y & 0xFF00 ) >> 8 ) )
00016 
00021 #define REVERSE_BYTE_ORDER_32( y ) ( ( ( y & 0x000000FF ) << 24 ) | ( ( y & 0x0000FF00 ) << 8 ) | ( ( y & 0x00FF0000 ) >> 8 ) | ( ( y & 0xFF000000 ) >> 24 ) )
00022

00031 /* NOTE: The following functions are necessary since the Sick LD doesn't adopt the
00032  *       convention of converting from network byte order.
00033  */
00034 
00040 inline uint16_t host_to_sick_ld_byte_order( uint16_t value ) {
00041   return REVERSE_BYTE_ORDER_16(value);
00042 }

00050   return REVERSE_BYTE_ORDER_32(value);

00059   return REVERSE_BYTE_ORDER_16(value);

00067 inline uint32_t sick_ld_to_host_byte_order( uint32_t value ) {
00068   return REVERSE_BYTE_ORDER_32(value);
00069 }
00070 
00071 #else // The host has a big-endian architecture
